intro: Anacantha darwasica, commonly known as the Darwasic spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and smooth, sometimes hairy stems. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing its adaptability to dry environments. Its leaves are usually alternate and simple, with a slightly succulent texture. Anacantha darwasica is often found in rocky soils and is known for its resilience in harsh climates.
